trial_identification.studytitle: Dietary intake of micronutrients during pregnancy and breastfeeding after government initiatives to increase iodine intake
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Micronutrient intakes and status in pregnant and breastfeeding women after government initiatives to increase iodine intake

conditions.healthcondition: Iodine intake and status during pregnancy and lactation
Selenium intake and status during pregnancy and lactation
Dietary intake of other nutrients during pregnancy and lactation

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: There have been two government initiatives to improve iodine intake and status. These are the mandatory fortification of bread with iodised salt and the provision of a subsidised iodine supplement for all pregnant and lactating women. This study will investigate how much fortified bread women habitually consume, the uptake of the subsidised supplement and the effect of both on iodine intake and status. This is an observational study investigating the behaviour of free living indiviuals no intervention will be given. Recruitment will last 6 months
interventions.comparator: Iodine and selenium intakes in pregnant and breastfeeding women in previous New Zealand studies from 1990 to 2009. Also previous study by researchers http://www.ANZCTR.org.au/ACTRN12612000240842.aspx

primaryOutcome.outcome: Iodine and selenium concentrations measured in samples of urine collected over 24 hours
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Pregnant women of gestational age greater than 26 weeks and lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Iodine and selenium concentrations measured in samples of breastmilk
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Dietary intake of other nutrients assessed using three 24 hour diet histories and dietary assessment computer package (Foodworks 2009)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pregnant women of gestational age greater than 26 weeks and lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy pregnant women > 26 weeks gestation Healthy breastfeeding women > 3 weeks postpartum
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: No medical complications No complications during pregnancy or breastfeeding No medications containing iodine or selenium

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Massey University Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Massey University Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Massey University Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Iodine and selenium intakes are known to be low in New Zealand. Two government initaitives have been introduced to improve intake among pregnant and lactating women. This study will investigate the effect of these initiatives on iodine intake and status. Selenium intake and status and the intake of other nutrients will also be assessed.
